35.verse: And he made the veil of blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff] and fine twined linen, with cherubim skillfully worked.

36.verse: For [the veil] he made four pillars of acacia [wood] and overlaid them with gold; their hooks were of gold, and he cast for them four sockets or bases of silver.

37.verse: And he made a screen for the tent door of blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff] and fine twined linen, embroidered,

38.verse: And he made the five pillars of it with their hooks, and overlaid their ornamental tops and joinings with gold, but their five sockets were of bronze.

1.verse: BEZALEL MADE the ark of acacia wood--two cubits and a half was the length of it, a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it.

2.verse: He overlaid it with pure gold within and without and made a molding or crown of gold to go around the top of it.

3.verse: He cast four rings of gold for its four corners, two rings on either side.

4.verse: He made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

5.verse: He put the poles through the rings at the sides of the ark to carry it.

6.verse: [Bezalel] made the mercy seat of pure gold, two cubits and a half its length and one cubit and a half its breadth.

7.verse: And he made two cherubim of beaten gold; on the two ends of the mercy seat he made them,

8.verse: One cherub at one end and one at the other end; of one piece with the mercy seat he made the cherubim at its two ends.

9.verse: And the cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces to each other, looking down to the mercy seat.

10.verse: Bezalel made the [showbread] table of acacia wood; it was two cubits long, a cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.

11.verse: He overlaid it with pure gold and made a molding of gold around its top.

12.verse: And he made a border around it [just under the top] a handbreadth wide, and a molding of gold around the border.

13.verse: And he cast for it four rings of gold and fastened the rings on the four corners that were at its four legs.

14.verse: Close to the border were the rings, the places for the poles to pass through to carry the [showbread] table.

15.verse: [Bezalel] made the poles of acacia wood to carry the [showbread] table and overlaid them with gold.

16.verse: He made of pure gold the vessels which were to be on the table, its plates and dishes [for bread], its bowls and flagons for pouring [liquid sacrifices].

17.verse: And he made the lampstand of pure gold; its base and shaft were made of hammered work; its cups, its knobs, and its flowers were of one piece with it.

18.verse: There were six branches going out of the sides of the lampstand, three branches out of one side of it and three branches out of the other side of it;

19.verse: Three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, each with a [calyx] knob and a flower, and three cups made like almond blossoms in the [opposite] branch, each with a [calyx] knob and a flower; and so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.

20.verse: On [the shaft of] the lampstand were four cups made like almond blossoms, with knobs and flowers [one at the top].

21.verse: And a knob under each pair of branches, of one piece with the lampstand, for the six branches going out of it.

22.verse: Their knobs and their branches were of one piece with it, all of it hammered work of pure gold.

23.verse: And he made of pure gold its seven lamps, its snuffers, and its ashtrays.

24.verse: Of a talent of pure gold he made the lampstand and all its utensils.

25.verse: And [Bezalel] made the incense altar of acacia wood; its top was a cubit square and it was two cubits high; the horns were one piece with it.

26.verse: He overlaid it with pure gold, its top, its sides round about, and its horns; also he made a rim around it of gold.

27.verse: And he made two rings of gold for it under its rim, on its two opposite sides, as places for the poles [to pass through] to carry it.

28.verse: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

29.verse: He also made the holy anointing oil [symbol of the Holy Spirit] and the pure, fragrant incense, after the perfumer's art.

1.verse: BEZALEL MADE the burnt offering altar of acacia wood; its top was five cubits square and it was three cubits high.

2.verse: He made its horns on the four corners of it; the horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.

3.verse: He made all the utensils and vessels of the altar, the pots, shovels, basins, forks or fleshhooks, and firepans; all its utensils and vessels he made of bronze.

4.verse: And he made for the altar a bronze grate of network under its ledge, extending halfway down it.

5.verse: He cast four rings for the four corners of the bronze grating to be places for the poles [with which to carry it].

6.verse: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.

7.verse: And he put the poles through the rings on the altar's sides with which to carry it; he made it hollow with planks.

8.verse: He made the laver and its base of bronze from the mirrors of the women who ministered at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

9.verse: And he made the court: for the south side the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a hundred cubits;

10.verse: Their pillars and their bronze sockets or bases were twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their joinings were silver.

11.verse: And for the north side the hangings were [also] a hundred cubits; their pillars and their sockets or bases of bronze were twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their joinings were of silver.

12.verse: But for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits; their pillars and their sockets or bases were ten; the hooks of the pillars and their joinings were of silver.

13.verse: And for the front, the east side, fifty cubits.

14.verse: The hangings for one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three and their sockets or bases three.

15.verse: Also for the other side of the court gate, left and right, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three and their sockets or bases three.

16.verse: All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.

17.verse: The sockets for the pillars were of bronze, the hooks of the pillars and their joinings of silver, the overlaying of their tops of silver, and all the pillars of the court were joined with silver.

18.verse: The hanging or screen for the gate of the court was embroidered in blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff], and fine twined linen; the length was twenty cubits and the height in the breadth was five cubits, corresponding to the hangings of the court.

19.verse: Their pillars were four and their sockets of bronze four; their hooks were of silver, and the overlaying of their tops and their joinings were of silver.

20.verse: All the pegs for the tabernacle and around the court were of bronze.

21.verse: This is the sum of the things for the tabernacle of the Testimony, as counted at the command of Moses, for the work of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the [high] priest.

22.verse: Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the Lord commanded Moses.

23.verse: With him was Aholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, a skillful craftsman, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff], and in fine linen.

24.verse: All the gold that was used for the work in all the building and furnishing of the sanctuary, the gold from the offering, was 29 talents and 730 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.

25.verse: And the silver from those numbered of the congregation was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, by sanctuary standards:

26.verse: A beka for each man, that is, half a shekel, by the sanctuary shekel, for everyone who was counted, from twenty years old and upward, for 603,550 men.

27.verse: The 100 talents of silver were for casting the sockets or bases of the sanctuary and of the veil; 100 sockets for the 100 talents, a talent for a socket.

28.verse: Of the 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their tops, and made joinings for them.

29.verse: The bronze of the offering was 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.

30.verse: With it Bezalel made the sockets for the door of the Tent of Meeting, and the bronze altar and the bronze grate for it, and all the utensils of the altar,

31.verse: The sockets of the court round about and of the court gate, and all the pegs of the tabernacle and around the court.

1.verse: AND OF the blue and purple and scarlet [stuff] they made finely wrought garments for serving in the Holy Place; they made the holy garments for Aaron, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

2.verse: And Bezalel made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff], and fine twined linen.

3.verse: And they beat the gold into thin sheets and cut it into wires to work into the blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff] and the fine linen, in skilled design.

4.verse: They made shoulder pieces for the ephod, joined to it at its two edges.

5.verse: And the skillfully woven band on it, to gird it on, was of the same piece and workmanship with it, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff], and fine twined linen, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

6.verse: And they prepared the onyx stones enclosed in settings of gold filigree and engraved as signets are engraved with the names of the sons of Israel.

7.verse: And he put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod to be stones of memorial or remembrance for the Israelites, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

8.verse: And [Bezalel] made the breastplate skillfully, like the work of the ephod, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet [stuff], and fine twined linen.

9.verse: The breastplate was a [hand's] span square when doubled over.

10.verse: And they set in it four rows of stones; a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle made the first row;

11.verse: The second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;

12.verse: The third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

13.verse: And the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper; they were enclosed in settings of gold filigree.

14.verse: There were twelve stones with their names according to those of the sons of Israel, engraved like a signet, each with its name, according to the twelve tribes.

15.verse: And they made [at the ends] of the breastplate twisted chains like cords, of pure gold.

16.verse: And they made two settings of gold filigree and two gold rings which they put on the two ends of the breastplate.

17.verse: And they put the two twisted cords or woven chains of gold in the two rings on the end edges of the breastplate.

18.verse: And the other two ends of the twisted cords or chains of gold they put on the two settings and put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, in front.

19.verse: They made two rings of gold and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on the inside edge of it next to the ephod.

20.verse: And they made two [other] gold rings and attached them to the two shoulder pieces of the ephod underneath, in front, at its joining above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.

21.verse: They bound the breastplate by its rings to those of the ephod with a blue lace, that it might lie upon the skillfully woven band of the ephod and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod, as the Lord commanded Moses.

22.verse: And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work all of blue.

23.verse: And there was an opening [for the head] in the middle of the robe like the hole in a coat of mail, with a binding around it, that it should not be torn.

24.verse: On the skirts of the robe they made pomegranates of blue and purple and scarlet [stuff] and twined linen.

25.verse: And they made bells of pure gold and put [them] between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe;

26.verse: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about on the skirts of the robe for ministering, as the Lord commanded Moses.

27.verse: And they made the long and sleeved tunics woven of fine linen for Aaron and his sons,

28.verse: And the turban, and the ornamental caps of fine linen, and the breeches of fine twined linen,

29.verse: The girdle or sash of fine twined linen, and blue, purple, and scarlet embroidery, as the Lord commanded Moses.

30.verse: And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold and wrote upon it an inscription, like the engravings of a signet, HOLY TO THE LORD.

31.verse: They tied to it a lace of blue to fasten it on the turban above, as the Lord commanded Moses.

32.verse: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting was finished; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so the Israelites had done.

33.verse: And they brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent and all its furnishings, its clasps, its [frame] boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets or bases;

34.verse: And the covering of rams' skins made red, and the covering of dolphin or porpoise skins, and the veil of the screen;

35.verse: The ark of the Testimony, its poles, and the mercy seat;

36.verse: The table and all its utensils, and the showbread (bread of the Presence);

37.verse: The pure [gold] lampstand and its lamps, with the lamps set in order, all its utensils, and the oil for the light;

38.verse: The golden altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the hanging for the door of the tent;

39.verse: The bronze altar and its grate of bronze, its poles and all its utensils; the laver and its base;

40.verse: The hangings of the court, its pillars and sockets or bases, and the screen for the court gate, its cords, and pegs, and all the utensils for the service of the tabernacle, for the Tent of Meeting [of God with His people];

41.verse: The finely worked vestments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons to minister as priests.

42.verse: According to all that the Lord had commanded Moses, so the Israelites had done all the work.

43.verse: And Moses inspected all the work, and behold, they had done it; as the Lord had commanded, so had they done it. And Moses blessed them.

1.verse: AND THE Lord said to Moses,

2.verse: On the first day of the first month you shall set up the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting [of God with you].

3.verse: And you shall put in it the ark of the Testimony and screen the ark [of God's Presence] with the veil.

4.verse: You shall bring in the [showbread] table and set in order the things that are to be upon it; and you shall bring in the lampstand and set up and light its lamps.

5.verse: You shall set the golden altar for the incense before the ark of the Testimony [outside the veil] and put the hanging or screen at the tabernacle door.

6.verse: You shall set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.

7.verse: And you shall set the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and put water in it.

8.verse: And you shall set up the court [curtains] round about and hang up the hanging or screen at the court gate.

9.verse: You shall take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and shall consecrate it and all its furniture, and it shall be holy.

10.verse: You shall anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils; and consecrate (set apart for God) the altar, and the altar shall be most holy.

11.verse: And you shall anoint the laver and its base and consecrate it.

12.verse: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the Tent of Meeting and wash them with water.

13.verse: You shall put on Aaron the holy garments, and anoint and consecrate him, so he may serve Me as priest.

14.verse: And you shall bring his sons and put long and sleeved tunics on them,

15.verse: And you shall anoint them as you anointed their father, that they may minister to Me as priests; for their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.

16.verse: Thus did Moses; according to all that the Lord commanded him, so he did.

17.verse: And on the first day of the first month in the second year the tabernacle was erected.

18.verse: Moses set up the tabernacle, laid its sockets, set up its boards, put in its bars, and erected its pillars.

19.verse: [Moses] spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent over it, as the Lord had commanded him.

20.verse: He took the Testimony [the Ten Commandments] and put it into the ark, and set the poles [in the rings] on the ark, and put the mercy seat on top of the ark.

21.verse: [Moses] brought the ark into the tabernacle and set up the veil of the screen and screened the ark of the Testimony, as the Lord had commanded him.

22.verse: Moses put the table [of showbread] in the Tent of Meeting on the north side of the tabernacle outside the veil;

23.verse: He set the bread [of the Presence] in order on it before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded him.

24.verse: And he put the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle.

25.verse: Moses set up and lighted the lamps before the Lord, as the Lord commanded him.

26.verse: He put the golden altar [of incense] in the Tent of Meeting before the veil;

27.verse: He burned sweet incense [symbol of prayer] upon it, as the Lord commanded him.

28.verse: And he set up the hanging or screen at the door of the tabernacle.

29.verse: [Moses] put the altar of burnt offering at the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting and offered on it the burnt offering and the cereal offering, as the Lord commanded him.

30.verse: And Moses set the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing.

31.verse: And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet there.

32.verse: When they went into the Tent of Meeting or came near the altar, they washed, as the Lord commanded Moses.

33.verse: And he erected the court round about the tabernacle and the altar and set up the hanging or screen at the court gate. So Moses finished the work.

34.verse: Then the cloud [the Shekinah, God's visible presence] covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle!

35.verse: And Moses was not able to enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud remained upon it, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.

36.verse: In all their journeys, whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the Israelites went onward;

37.verse: But if the cloud was not taken up, they did not journey on till the day that it was taken up.

38.verse: For throughout all their journeys the cloud of the Lord was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was in it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel.
